turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about General Electric.
turn.1: What company owns the Washington Nationals?
turn.2: General Electric  General Electric Company (GE) is an American multinational conglomerate incorporated in New York City and headquartered in Boston.
turn.3: What is the main operation of the company?
turn.4: , the company operates through the following segments: aviation, healthcare, power, renewable energy, digital industry, additive manufacturing, venture capital and finance, lighting, and oil and gas.
turn.5: Where did the company have operations?
turn.6: GE has a subsidiary in Bermuda.
turn.7: Is the company a top performer?
turn.8: In 2018, GE ranked among the Fortune 500 as the 18th-largest firm in the U.S. by gross revenue.
turn.9: Is the company a good stock to buy?
turn.10: In 2011, GE ranked among the Fortune 20 as the 14th-most profitable company but has since very severely underperformed the market (by about 75%) as its profitability collapsed.
turn.11: Have the company's employees won any awards?
turn.12: Two employees of GE—Irving Langmuir (1932) and Ivar Giaever (1973)—have been awarded the Nobel Prize.
